name: Gossypium
Relationship: Compare: Action similar to Ergot when made from fresh green root. LILIUM; CIMICIF.; SABINA.

Head: Pain in cervical region with tendency for head to draw backward with nervousness
Stomach: Anorexia, with uneasy feeling at scrobiculum at time of menses
Nausea, with inclination to vomit before breakfast
Female: Morning sickness, with sensitive uterine region
Backache, weight and dragging in pelvis
Tumor of the breast with swelling of axillary glands
Uterine sub-involution and fibroids, with gastric pain and debility

details: A powerful emmenagogue, used in physiological doses. Homeopathically, it corresponds to many reflex conditions, depending on disturbed uterine function and pregnancy. Gossypium will relieve tardy menses, especially with sensation that the flow is about to start and yet does not do so. Tall, bloodless patients, with nervous chills.
